source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Erigeron
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1999). Erigeron. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria . Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Plants with spreading, slender, often branched rhizomes; leaves crowded but rarely truly rosetted at base, passing gradually into bracts of peduncles; plants of moist mossbeds, heathlands and swampy sites
Plants with short, thickish rhizomes, solitary or colony-forming; leaves in a basal rosette, distinctly differentiated from bracts of peduncles
Leaves viscid (often shining) from more or less sessile glandular hairs
Leaves non-viscid, glabrous or with eglandular hairs
Leaves and peduncles pubescent; leaves commonly wider than 1 cm; widespread in alps
Leaves and peduncles glabrous; leaves to 1 cm wide; Baw Baw Plateau
